title: Lightning Strikes: 12 lives lost to lightning strikes in Bihar | Patna News - Times of India
text: Patna/Gaya:At least 12 people, including a couple, died and three others were injured in lightning strikes in four districts in the last 24 hours. Expressing grief over the deaths, chief minister Nitish Kumar on Thursday announced an ex gratia payment of Rs 4 lakh each to the next of kin of the deceased.According to a news release from the information and public relations department, five persons died and three were injured in Belaganj police station area of Gaya district on Thursday, while three persons lost their lives in Jehanabad and two each in Rohtas and Nalanda districts.The three injured were admitted to Belaganj primary/community health centre. The CM has ordered the Gaya administration to give proper treatment to the injured.Gaya district magistrate (DM) Thiyagarajan S M identified the five deceased as Jitendra Dangi and his wife Meera Devi, besides Shankar Ram, Kapil Yadav and Bali Bhagat.We also published the following articles recently12 die in Bihar lightning strikesTwelve people, including a couple, lost their lives to lightning strikes in Bihar within the past 24 hours. The state experienced fatalities across Gaya, Jehanabad, Rohtas, and Nalanda districts. Bihar CM Nitish Kumar announced Rs 4 lakh ex gratia to each victim's next of kin and advised residents to follow safety guidelines during adverse weather.112205766Tamil Nadu rain: Three die as houses collapse in Coimbatore districtIn Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu, a woman and her granddaughter died when their house collapsed due to rain near Sholayar dam. A 21-year-old student also perished in Thippampatti village after a mud wall fell on him. The incidents occurred in the early hours of Tuesday.
